title: Bharat Shakti: India To Display 'Might Of Indigenous Weapons' At Tri-Services Exercise In Pokhran; Details
text:
The integrated tri-service exercise, 'Bharat Shakti', will showcase the "might of indigenous weapons & equipment" possessed by India, the Army said in a post on social media platform X (formerly Twitter).
#BharatShakti
स्वदेशीकरण से सशक्तिकरण
Displaying the might of indigenous weapons & equipment of #IndianArmedForces .
On 12 Mar 2024 at #Pokaran Field Firing Ranges (Rajasthan). #AatmanirbharBharat #YearofTechAbsorption @DefenceMinIndia @HQ_IDS_India @IAF_MCC @indiannavy pic.twitter.com/poRvYHjOZh
— ADG PI - INDIAN ARMY (@adgpi) March 9, 2024 \n\n
PM Modi To Witness Firepower Demonstration
Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to attend the exercise, news agency PTI reported. According to the army, the tri-service exercise will feature live fire demonstrations. The joint exercise will be held for about 50 minutes, Additional Director General, Army Design Bureau, Major General CS Mann informed.
Made-In-India Weapons To Steal The Show
Indigenously developed weapon platforms like Tejas light combat aircraft (LCA), HAL Rudra advanced light helicopter (ALH), Dhanush howitzers, and Pinaka multi-barrel rocket launchers as well as armaments developed by other countries but manufactured locally, like T90 battle tanks and K9 Vajra self-propelled howitzers, will be demonstrated during the exercise, Major General Mann said.
Drills To Simulate Multi-Domain Ops
Drills simulating integrated multi-domain operations will be performed as part of 'Bharat Shakti', Maj Gen Mann said. "The exercise will showcase live integrated multi-domain operations of the three services in offensive operations using indigenous equipment," he was quoted as saying by PTI.
Aim To Achieve Operational Efficiency
As per the army, 'Bharat Shakti' is aimed at instilling a 'shock and awe' capability that the three forces can use in actual operations. "It will showcase the 'shock and awe' that the three services seek to achieve in an operational situation by employing manoeuvre and fighting capabilities effectively," Major General Mann said.
(With inputs from agencies)
